description: Master Resource Routes, Model Binding, and Route Caching.

slides.title: Resource Controllers
slides.content:
# CRUD in One Line ‚ö°

Automatically create routes for all 7 CRUD actions (index, create, store, show, edit, update, destroy).

`Route::resource('photos', PhotoController::class);`

slides.content:
# 404 Handling üîö

Define a route that executes when no other route matches.

`Route::fallback(function () { ... });`

slides.title: Rate Limiting
slides.content:
# Throttling üõë

Limit traffic to routes.

`Route::middleware('throttle:60,1')->group(function () { ... });`

Allows 60 requests per minute.

slides.title: Binding Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What happens if Route Model Binding fails to find a matching model instance?
quizOptions: It automatically throws a 404 HTTP Error
It creates a new empty model

slides.title: Form Method Spoofing
slides.content:
# PUT & DELETE üé≠

HTML forms only support GET and POST. To send PUT/DELETE, add a hidden field.

`<form action="/foo/bar" method="POST">`
`@method('PUT')`
`@csrf`
`</form>`

slides.title: Redirect Routes
slides.content:
# Easy Hop üê∞

If you defined a route that needs to redirect elsewhere.

`Route::redirect('/here', '/there', 301);`

slides.title: View Routes
slides.content:
# Simple Pages üìÑ

If a route only returns a view, use the shortcut.

`Route::view('/welcome', 'welcome', ['name' => 'Taylor']);`

slides.title: Route Caching
slides.content:
# Speed Boost üöÄ

In production, register all routes.

`php artisan route:cache`

Drastically speeds up route registration (hundreds of ms saved).
